extendedIngredients.name: rocket salad
extendedIngredients.original: 1-2 cups baby spinach and/or salad rocket (Arugula)

extendedIngredients.name: ciabatta
extendedIngredients.original: 1 loaf of ciabatta (or other Italian white bread)

extendedIngredients.name: ground pepper
extendedIngredients.original: salt flakes & ground pepper to taste
extendedIngredients.originalName: salt flakes & ground pepper to taste

extendedIngredients.name: mint
extendedIngredients.original: ½ cup fresh herbs like mint and basil
extendedIngredients.originalName: fresh herbs like mint and basil

extendedIngredients.name: pistachio nuts
extendedIngredients.original: ¼ cup pistachio nuts (or try pine nuts or walnuts)

title: Greeni Crostini
summary: Greeni Crostini is a vegan recipe with 6 servings. One serving contains 316 calories, 11g of protein, and 10g of fat. For $1.5 per serving, this recipe covers 10% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It works best as a hor d'oeuvre, and is done in roughly 2 minutes. It is a reasonably priced recipe for fans of Mediterranean food. A couple people made this recipe, and 17 would say it hit the spot. If you have salt flakes & ground pepper, baby spinach and/or salad rocket, olive oil, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 70%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are Crostini di fegatini (Tuscan Chicken Liver Crostini), Crostini di Fegatini (Chicken Liver Crostini), and Mixed Crostini: Crostini Misti.
instructions: Transfer to a bowl and taste test, adding salt and pepper to taste with the zest of about  the lemon, stir to combine. {This can be made ahead of time and refrigerated for a few hours until you are ready to serve.}Just before serving slice the ciabatta into 1.5cm ( inch) thick rounds and toast either in a sandwich press, under the grill or on a barbeque until golden and crispy.Rub each slice of crostini with the cut side of a clove of garlic and top with about 1 tablespoon of the pea & spinach mixture. Garnish with a little fresh mint or basil and drizzle over a splash of olive oil.The perfect quick vegetarian appetizer recipe for entertaining! Add crumbled feta or goats cheese on top for a non-vegan version.

Garnish with a little fresh mint or basil and drizzle over a splash of olive oil.The perfect quick vegetarian appetizer recipe for entertaining!
